result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenna Grace Clarke

defendant.name: Clarke, Brenna Grace
defendant.address: 15851 West Riviera Drive, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Brenna Grace Clarke.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed 10 hours of the community service hours, and a letter of apology. Defendant needs to complete the remaining 20 hours of the community service hours in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Apology Letter
Received and Filed. Notice of Competition

Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DPA Document.
Received and Filed.
1220 Battery WIS JI - Criminal
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
1498 ( Retail theft)  WIS JI - Criminal

Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Deferred Prosecution  Hearing.
Defense counsel request a status date  advising the court he need additional time to review discovery.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be held in person. 
  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30pm

Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense informs the court the defendant has completed a TAD evaluation and requests a DPA hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference.  Defendant informs the Court the defendant has a tad evaluation scheduled on 5-16-2022 and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court with attorney Matt Kline for Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and potention dpa offer.
State confirms. Defendant need to have a tad assessment completed.  Defense request a status date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brenna Grace Clarke appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case adjourned to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Pre-trial conference on March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kwik Pantry Foods; J.J.P.; G.S.

Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Brenna Grace Clarke in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brenna Grace Clarke appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
